text:
Hi!

I get information about Landing Page using the query GET /content/api/v2/pages/:page_id (<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/pages/get_pages_page_id?_ga=2.135653365.534606477.1618827085-1956889231.1618215804>)

In the answer data I receive the template_path key with such meaning: @ HubSpot / basic_v2_theme / templates / basic _-_ ebook_offer.html

I would like to get this basic _-_ ebook_offer.html but I don't understand what @HubSpot is

Hi <@U01BBV0L2CF>,

I used V2 and V3 company api, compared data and have some gap. Do you know why have in V3 much less column and info than in V2?(5column vs more than 100 column

Thanks

Hi guys! Recently created a custom object in HubSpot and wanting to create an association with deals. So, heres the link I'm using as per the documentation:
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/schemas/p7069430_investor/associations?portalId=7069430>
Can anyone point me in the direction as to why it's not working? I'm guessing its because i need to include my API key somewhere?
Here you can put the API key, object id and association with.

In V3 you get a few default properties, but you can specify the full list of properties you want (including custom properties) by providing a comma-separated list of property names as the `properties` URL parameter.
thanks for that! it will come in really useful!
The image you sent further up - what URL is that? Where can i access the resource that builds the url for you?
the image is from the same URL I sent you. You can go there following the this image.
